title: Publisher Rocket Step by Step Tutorial for Amazon KDP Publishing

tactics.name: Competitor Analysis
tactics.description: Use Publisher Rocket to evaluate niche viability by analyzing competitors' metrics
steps: Search for niche keywords like '101 story starters'
Review average pages, price, and monthly earnings
Check competitive score and Amazon search volume
caveats: May not account for seasonal trends
source_quotes: 'competitive score is pretty good this one here now look...`

tactics.name: Keyword Research Analysis
tactics.description: Use Publisher Rocket to analyze keywords and check competitor books' performance metrics
steps: Input keywords into Publisher Rocket's keyword research tool
Export data to spreadsheet for detailed analysis
Check competitor books' BSR, daily sales, and categories
caveats: Data may not reflect real-time market changes
source_quotes: we can actually find out more about it

tactics.name: Category Optimization
tactics.description: Identify and add multiple categories to improve book discoverability
steps: Check existing categories of successful books
Add up to 8 categories during KDP upload
Use Publisher Rocket to find trending categories
source_quotes: you can add a further six categories

tactics.name: Category Search for Rankings
tactics.description: Use Publisher Rocket to analyze category rankings and sales thresholds for bestseller positions.
steps: Search for target categories (e.g., children's books)
Check sales numbers required for top rankings (e.g., 250 sales for #1 in paper crafts)
Contact KDP customer service to add extra categories
caveats: Avoid categories with irrelevant keywords (e.g., 'roblox story starters' for kids' books)
source_quotes: this is suggesting that for this paper crafts you to get to number one you'd need to do 2 250 sales

tactics.name: Keyword Search for Ads
tactics.description: Export Amazon search terms for keyword campaigns using Publisher Rocket's IMS keyword tool.
steps: Export data to spreadsheet and filter relevant keywords
Include ASINs and author names for targeted campaigns
source_quotes: this will provide the information that we're wanting for that and it just helps to get the keywords

heuristics.name: Low Competition Targeting
heuristics.condition: If competitive score is below 50 and review count is above 100
source_quotes: 'competitive score is pretty good this one here now look...`

heuristics.name: Sales Threshold Heuristic
heuristics.condition: If daily sales are below $200, consider market saturation

heuristics.name: Low-Review Category Boost
heuristics.condition: If median reviews are less than 200, prioritize categories with low competition
source_quotes: if we did for example education and teaching if we went down to this one here we check it out we want to find out the ranking of the number one book

claims.statement: Publisher Rocket provides lifetime access with a one-time payment under $100
KDP allows publishers to add up to 8 categories per book
source_quotes: you can actually choose you can just follow the link

claims.statement: KDP allows adding extra categories via customer service for books not already listed
source_quotes: you can contact kdp customer service to add the extra category to your book

niche_patterns.description: Target underserved niches with specific constraints
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Balances market demand with niche specificity
source_quotes: 'we've got a heap of different things that we can find out...`

niche_patterns.description: Target specific learning needs with age-appropriate content
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Combines educational value with developmental milestones
source_quotes: phonics storybook that looks uh like um
